page.title: 17A Niton Undercliff Tragedy
page.content: The local inhabitants were saddened to learn one November morning in 1984 that the famous Sandrock Hotel had suffered severe fire damage during the early hours.The Hotel,built in 1790, had had many distinguished visitors including Queen(then Princess) Victoria,who at the age of 15 stayed there. The event made a great impact on the local children one of whom wrote:"I think the Sandrock is destroyed completely and I don't think there will be another one like it.It's just ruined,shattered and a big lump of charcoal.It's empty,spooky and an unhappy sight.Just think how upset the people and the manager were when it was burnt down.It was 194 years old.I bet Queen Victoria would be upset too,(if she lived now)! I feel really sad about it because my uncle used to play in a band there."
